meanings.sent1: The children played under the auspices of their parents.
meanings.sent2: The organization provided auspices to the homeless shelter.
meanings.sent3: The cat sought auspices from its owner during the thunderstorm.
meanings.sent4: The old tree offered its auspices to the sapling growing beneath its shade.
meanings.sent5: The knight rode into battle under the auspices of his king, feeling invincible.

meanings.sent1: The artist flourished under the auspices of a wealthy benefactor.
meanings.sent2: The mentor provided auspices to the young entrepreneur starting her business.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy followed the auspices of the wise old dog in the park.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse served as a beacon of auspices for ships navigating the rocky coast.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's auspices helped the struggling student improve his grades significantly.

meanings.definition: Under the auspices of: with the help or support of
meanings.sent1: The event was organized under the auspices of the local community center.
meanings.sent2: The project was completed successfully under the auspices of a skilled team.
meanings.sent3: The picnic was held under the auspices of clear blue skies and warm sunshine.
meanings.sent4: The marathon runners raced under the auspices of cheering crowds lining the streets.
meanings.sent5: The garden flourished under the auspices of diligent watering and care from the gardener.
